projects.title: A Qualitative Study of the Contemporary Perspectives on Co-residence among ‘Boomerangs’ and their Mothers in England
projects.description: My postgraduate thesis, "A Qualitative Study of the Contemporary Perspectives on Co-residence among ‘Boomerangs’ and their Mothers in England" elicits the insights of mothers and their 'boomerang' children for 21 days with the use of diary methods. A thematic analysis was drawn using the structure-agency nexus and partially inspired by White's (1994) recommendations.

contributors.headline: Marie Skłodowska–Curie PhD fellow at VU University Medical Center in Amsterdam | ESR1 for EU commissioned Health CASCADE (Innovative Training Network)

projects.title: Analysis of Contemporary Concealed Families in Multi-Familial Households seen in England and Wales
projects.description:
My undergraduate thesis takes a theoretical, descriptive/explorative, and statistical perspective in regard to analysis of concealed families in the contemporary period of England and Wales. 
Concealed households are a signification of hidden homelessness and retain importance in light of the U.K.’s housing crisis/ methodological issues in related policy crafting and planning implementation. 
There is no clear-cut capacity in determining which requirement they fall into; despite the attempts in literature in which refer to such over time - such as, Rauta’s Governmental report (1986) and Bramley et al.’s (2010) work. I was granted expressed permissions in accessing and obtaining the LFS data from the U.K. DATA SERVICE archive, for the purposes of such secondary analysis. In this mode, I relied upon SPSS (statistical software) for data manipulation and processing: cross-tabulations, chi-squared tests and constructing a (binary) logistic regression model. I have shown how multi-generational households and concealed households overlap; therefore ought to transcend economic factors tied to residential arrangements, like cultural values.

projects.title: Contributor to Research BLOG
projects.description: As part of second year for my undergraduate degree at the University of Southampton, I went to Accra (Ghana) for research (as necessary for a module). In collaboration with my cohort, I had contributed to a blog about my experiences of the trip.

contributors.headline: Marie Skłodowska–Curie PhD fellow at VU University Medical Center in Amsterdam | ESR1 for EU commissioned Health CASCADE (Innovative Training Network)

projects.title: Initiating Project Fundraiser Activity for African Missions
projects.description: As part of my own initiative as a member of the National Honour Society, I had independently raised funds for the African Missions, to contribute towards a Water Project for the RSHM project. For this project, I had co-ordinated a fashion show which encouraged Middle School students to participate in. I had introduced a competitive aspect to help, in some light, account for the sustainability of the environment. The outfits worn (and designed) by the models strictly had to be using recyclable material, and were later set aside for recycling purposes and/or sent directly to the Missions. The audience were to donate entirely at their discretion following a deposit of £5 to secure their seat.

profile_positions.title: Sociology Conference Ambassador

volunteer_experiences.description: I engage with the Health CASCADE (HC) dissemination strategy, ensuring that it is carried out to optimal potential - by sourcing conferences, regulating dissemination-related record documents needing updates from HC stakeholders, maintaining protocol and administrative support related to dissemination etc.,

•	This type of work experience entailed observing the undertakings of Dr. Karim Kassam at Northwick Park hospital, for ten hours in total. Being immersed in the NHS environment enabled me to gauge an appreciation of the various roles and responsibilities within its structure.

•	Updated all required materials needed by the store (namely by adding tags to items for sale), supporting the manager with weekly operational functions, contributing to the creative design of showcase cabinets, and serving at the check-out desk in facilitating transactions of customers.
•	Gained a close-eye exposure in dealing with the daily lives of elderly people. Also, I had facilitated their evening entertainment, games and organised the bookshelves.
